member.name: P:Elasticsearch.Net.Connection.Configuration.IRequestConfiguration.RequestTimeout
member.summary: The timeout for this specific request, takes precedence over the global timeout settings

member.name: P:Elasticsearch.Net.Connection.Configuration.IRequestConfiguration.ConnectTimeout
member.summary: The connect timeout for this specific request

member.name: P:Elasticsearch.Net.Connection.Configuration.IRequestConfiguration.ContentType
member.summary: Force a difference content type header on the request

member.name: P:Elasticsearch.Net.Connection.Configuration.IRequestConfiguration.MaxRetries
member.summary: This will override whatever is set on the connection configuration or whatever default the connectionpool has.

member.name: P:Elasticsearch.Net.Connection.Configuration.IRequestConfiguration.ForceNode
member.summary: This will force the operation on the specified node, this will bypass any configured connection pool and will no retry.

member.name: P:Elasticsearch.Net.Connection.Configuration.IRequestConfiguration.DisableSniff
member.summary: Forces no sniffing to occur on the request no matter what configuration is in place globally

member.name: P:Elasticsearch.Net.Connection.Configuration.IRequestConfiguration.DisablePing
member.summary: Under no circumstance do a ping before the actual call. If a node was previously dead a small ping with low connect timeout will be tried first in normal circumstances

member.name: P:Elasticsearch.Net.Connection.Configuration.IRequestConfiguration.AllowedStatusCodes
member.summary: Treat the following statuses (on top of the 200 range) NOT as error.

members.member:
Basic access authorization credentials to specify with this request. Overrides any credentials that are set at the global IConnectionSettings level.
TODO: rename to BasicAuthenticationCredentials in 2.0

member.name: P:Elasticsearch.Net.Connection.Configuration.IRequestConfiguration.EnableHttpPipelining
member.summary:
Whether or not this request should be pipelined. http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/HTTP_pipelining
Note: HTTP pipelining must also be enabled in Elasticsearch for this to work properly.

member.name: M:Elasticsearch.Net.Connection.ITransportDelegator.GetMaximumRetries(Elasticsearch.Net.Connection.Configuration.IRequestConfiguration)
member.summary: Returns either the fixed maximum set on the connection configuration settings or the number of nodes

member.name: M:Elasticsearch.Net.Connection.ITransportDelegator.TookTooLongToRetry(Elasticsearch.Net.Connection.RequestState.ITransportRequestState)
member.summary: Returns whether the current delegation over nodes took too long and we should quit. if is set we'll use that timeout otherwise we default to th value of which itself defaults to 60 seconds

member.name: M:Elasticsearch.Net.Connection.ITransportDelegator.SelectNextNode(Elasticsearch.Net.Connection.RequestState.ITransportRequestState)
member.summary: Selects next node uri on request state
member.returns: bool hint whether the new current node needs to pinged first

member.name: M:Elasticsearch.Net.Connection.RequestHandlers.RequestHandlerBase.DoneProcessing``1(Elasticsearch.Net.ElasticsearchResponse{System.IO.Stream},Elasticsearch.Net.Connection.RequestState.TransportRequestState{``0},System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Determines whether the stream response is our final stream response: IF response is success or known error OR maxRetries is 0 and retried is 0 (maxRetries could change in between retries to 0) AND sniff on connection fault does not find more nodes (causing maxRetry to grow) AND maxretries is no retried

member.name: M:Elasticsearch.Net.Connection.RequestHandlers.RequestHandlerBase.TrySniffOnStaleClusterState``1(Elasticsearch.Net.Connection.RequestState.TransportRequestState{``0})
member.summary: Sniffs when the cluster state is stale, when sniffing returns a 401 return a response for T to return directly

member.name: M:Elasticsearch.Net.IElasticsearchClient.DoRequest``1(System.String,System.String,System.Object,Elasticsearch.Net.IRequestParameters)
member.summary: Perform any request you want over the configured IConnection synchronously while taking advantage of the cluster failover.
member.typeparam: The type representing the response JSON
member.param: the HTTP Method to use
The path of the the url that you would like to hit
The body of the request, string and byte[] are posted as is other types will be serialized to JSON
Optionally configure request specific timeouts, headers
member.returns: An ElasticsearchResponse of T where T represents the JSON response body

member.name: T:Elasticsearch.Net.Connection.ConnectionConfiguration
member.summary: ConnectionConfiguration allows you to control how ElasticsearchClient behaves and where/how it connects to elasticsearch

member.name: P:Elasticsearch.Net.Connection.IConnectionConfigurationValues.PingTimeout
member.summary: The timeout in milliseconds to use for ping calls that are issues to check whether a node is up or not.

member.name: P:Elasticsearch.Net.Connection.IConnectionConfigurationValues.MaxRetryTimeout
member.summary:
Limits the total runtime including retries separately from
When not specified defaults to which itself defaults to 60seconds

member.name: P:Elasticsearch.Net.Connection.IConnectionConfigurationValues.DisablePings
member.summary: This signals that we do not want to send initial pings to unknown/previously dead nodes and just send the call straightaway

member.name: P:Elasticsearch.Net.Connection.IConnectionConfigurationValues.ThrowOnElasticsearchServerExceptions
member.summary:
Instead of following a c/go like error checking on response.IsValid always throw an ElasticsearchServerException on the client when a call resulted in an exception on the elasticsearch server.
Reasons for such exceptions could be search parser errors, index missing exceptions

member.name: P:Elasticsearch.Net.Connection.IConnectionConfigurationValues.SniffsOnStartup
member.summary: Sniff the cluster state immediatly on startup

member.name: P:Elasticsearch.Net.Connection.IConnectionConfigurationValues.SniffsOnConnectionFault
member.summary: Force a new sniff for the cluster state everytime a connection dies

member.name: P:Elasticsearch.Net.Connection.IConnectionConfigurationValues.SniffInformationLifeSpan
member.summary: Force a new sniff for the cluster when the cluster state information is older than the specified timespan

member.name: P:Elasticsearch.Net.Connection.IConnectionConfigurationValues.QueryStringParameters
member.summary: Append these query string parameters automatically to every request

member.name: P:Elasticsearch.Net.Connection.IConnectionConfigurationValues.ConnectionStatusHandler
member.summary: Connection status handler that will be called everytime the connection receives anything.

members.member:
Basic access authorization credentials to specify with all requests.
TODO: Rename to BasicAuthenticationCredentials in 2.0

member.name: M:Elasticsearch.Net.Connection.ConnectionConfiguration`1.EnableCompressedResponses(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Enable compressed responses from elasticsearch (NOTE that that nodes need to be configured to allow this) http://www.elasticsearch.org/guide/en/elasticsearch/reference/current/modules-http.html

member.name: M:Elasticsearch.Net.Connection.ConnectionConfiguration`1.EnableTrace(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Enable Trace signals to the IConnection that it should put debug information on the Trace.

member.name: M:Elasticsearch.Net.Connection.ConnectionConfiguration`1.EnableMetrics(System.Boolean)
member.summary: By enabling metrics more metadata is returned per API call about requests (ping, sniff, failover) and general stats

member.name: M:Elasticsearch.Net.Connection.ConnectionConfiguration`1.ThrowOnElasticsearchServerExceptions(System.Boolean)
member.summary:
Instead of following a c/go like error checking on response.IsValid always throw an ElasticsearchServerException on the client when a call resulted in an exception on the elasticsearch server.
Reasons for such exceptions could be search parser errors, index missing exceptions

member.name: M:Elasticsearch.Net.Connection.ConnectionConfiguration`1.DisablePing(System.Boolean)
member.summary: When a node is used for the very first time or when it's used for the first time after it has been marked dead a ping with a very low timeout is send to the node to make sure that when it's still dead it reports it as fast as possible. You can disable these pings globally here if you rather have it fail on the possible slower original request

member.name: M:Elasticsearch.Net.Connection.ConnectionConfiguration`1.SetGlobalQueryStringParameters(System.Collections.Specialized.NameValueCollection)
member.summary: This NameValueCollection will be appended to every url NEST calls, great if you need to pass i.e an API key.

member.name: M:Elasticsearch.Net.Connection.ConnectionConfiguration`1.SetTimeout(System.Int32)
member.summary: Timeout in milliseconds when the .NET webrequest should abort the request, note that you can set this to a high value here, and specify the timeout in various calls on Elasticsearch's side.
member.param: time out in milliseconds

member.name: M:Elasticsearch.Net.Connection.ConnectionConfiguration`1.SetPingTimeout(System.Int32)
member.summary: This is a separate timeout for Ping() requests. A ping should fail as fast as possible.
member.param: The ping timeout in milliseconds defaults to 200

member.name: M:Elasticsearch.Net.Connection.ConnectionConfiguration`1.SetDeadTimeout(System.Int32)
member.summary: Sets the default dead timeout factor when a node has been marked dead.
member.remarks: Some connection pools may use a flat timeout whilst others take this factor and increase it exponentially

member.name: M:Elasticsearch.Net.Connection.ConnectionConfiguration`1.SetMaxDeadTimeout(System.Int32)
member.summary: Sets the maximum time a node can be marked dead. Different implementations of IConnectionPool may choose a different default.
member.param: The timeout in milliseconds

member.name: M:Elasticsearch.Net.Connection.ConnectionConfiguration`1.SetMaxRetryTimeout(System.TimeSpan)
member.summary:
Limits the total runtime including retries separately from
When not specified defaults to which itself defaults to 60seconds

member.name: M:Elasticsearch.Net.Connection.ConnectionConfiguration`1.SetMaximumAsyncConnections(System.Int32)
member.summary: Semaphore asynchronous connections automatically by giving it a maximum concurrent connections.
member.param: defaults to 0 (unbounded)

member.name: M:Elasticsearch.Net.Connection.ConnectionConfiguration`1.SetProxy(System.Uri,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: If your connection has to go through proxy use this method to specify the proxy url

member.name: M:Elasticsearch.Net.Connection.ConnectionConfiguration`1.UsePrettyResponses(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Append ?pretty=true to requests, this helps to debug send and received json.

member.name: M:Elasticsearch.Net.Connection.ConnectionConfiguration`1.ExposeRawResponse(System.Boolean)
member.summary:
Make sure the reponse bytes are always available on the ElasticsearchResponse object
Note: that depending on the registered serializer this may cause the respond to be read in memory first

member.name: M:Elasticsearch.Net.Connection.ConnectionConfiguration`1.SetConnectionStatusHandler(System.Action{Elasticsearch.Net.IElasticsearchResponse})
member.summary: Global callback for every response that NEST receives, useful for custom logging.

member.name: M:Elasticsearch.Net.Connection.ConnectionConfiguration`1.SetBasicAuthorization(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Basic access authentication credentials to specify with all requests.

member.name: M:Elasticsearch.Net.Connection.ConnectionConfiguration`1.SetBasicAuthentication(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Basic access authentication credentials to specify with all requests.

member.name: M:Elasticsearch.Net.Connection.ConnectionConfiguration`1.HttpPipeliningEnabled(System.Boolean)
member.summary:
Allows for requests to be pipelined. http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/HTTP_pipelining
Note: HTTP pipelining must also be enabled in Elasticsearch for this to work properly.

member.name: M:Elasticsearch.Net.Connection.IConnectionConfiguration`1.EnableCompressedResponses(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Enable compressed responses from elasticsearch (NOTE that that nodes need to be configured to allow this) http://www.elasticsearch.org/guide/en/elasticsearch/reference/current/modules-http.html

member.name: M:Elasticsearch.Net.Connection.IConnectionConfiguration`1.EnableTrace(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Enable Trace signals to the IConnection that it should put debug information on the Trace.

member.summary: This NameValueCollection will be appended to every url NEST calls, great if you need to pass i.e an API key.

member.summary: If your connection has to go through proxy use this method to specify the proxy url

member.summary: Append ?pretty=true to requests, this helps to debug send and received json.

member.name: M:Elasticsearch.Net.Connection.IConnectionConfiguration`1.SetMaximumAsyncConnections(System.Int32)
member.summary: Semaphore asynchronous connections automatically by giving it a maximum concurrent connections. Great to prevent out of memory exceptions
member.param: defaults to 20

member.name: M:Elasticsearch.Net.Connection.IConnectionConfiguration`1.SetConnectionStatusHandler(System.Action{Elasticsearch.Net.IElasticsearchResponse})
member.summary: Global callback for every response that NEST receives, useful for custom logging.

member.name: M:Elasticsearch.Net.Connection.ConnectionConfiguration.#ctor(System.Uri)
member.summary: ConnectionConfiguration allows you to control how ElasticsearchClient behaves and where/how it connects to elasticsearch
member.param: The root of the elasticsearch node we want to connect to. Defaults to http://localhost:9200

member.name: M:Elasticsearch.Net.Connection.ConnectionConfiguration.#ctor(Elasticsearch.Net.ConnectionPool.IConnectionPool)
member.summary: ConnectionConfiguration allows you to control how ElasticsearchClient behaves and where/how it connects to elasticsearch
member.param: A connection pool implementation that'll tell the client what nodes are available

member.name: M:Elasticsearch.Net.ConnectionPool.IConnectionPool.GetNext(System.Nullable{System.Int32},System.Int32@,System.Boolean@)
member.summary: Gets the next live Uri to perform the request on
member.param: pass the original seed when retrying, this guarantees that the nodes are walked in a predictable manner even when called in a multithreaded context
The seed this call started on

member.name: M:Elasticsearch.Net.ConnectionPool.IConnectionPool.MarkDead(System.Uri,System.Nullable{System.Int32},System.Nullable{System.Int32})
member.summary: Mark the specified Uri as dead

member.name: M:Elasticsearch.Net.ConnectionPool.IConnectionPool.MarkAlive(System.Uri)
member.summary: Bring the specified uri back to life.

member.name: M:Elasticsearch.Net.ConnectionPool.IConnectionPool.UpdateNodeList(System.Collections.Generic.IList{System.Uri},System.Uri)
member.summary: Update the node list manually, usually done by ITransport when sniffing was needed.
member.param: hint that the node we recieved the sniff from should not be pinged

member.name: P:Elasticsearch.Net.ConnectionPool.IConnectionPool.MaxRetries
member.summary: Returns the default maximum retries for the connection pool implementation. Most implementation default to number of nodes, note that this can be overidden in the connection settings

member.name: P:Elasticsearch.Net.ConnectionPool.IConnectionPool.AcceptsUpdates
member.summary: Signals that this implemenation can accept new nodes

member.name: M:Elasticsearch.Net.Connection.Transport.Elasticsearch#Net#Connection#ITransportDelegator#TookTooLongToRetry(Elasticsearch.Net.Connection.RequestState.ITransportRequestState)
member.summary: Returns whether the current delegation over nodes took too long and we should quit. if is set we'll use that timeout otherwise we default to th value of which itself defaults to 60 seconds

member.name: M:Elasticsearch.Net.Connection.Transport.Elasticsearch#Net#Connection#ITransportDelegator#GetMaximumRetries(Elasticsearch.Net.Connection.Configuration.IRequestConfiguration)
member.summary: Returns either the fixed maximum set on the connection configuration settings or the number of nodes

member.name: M:Elasticsearch.Net.Connection.Transport.Elasticsearch#Net#Connection#ITransportDelegator#SelectNextNode(Elasticsearch.Net.Connection.RequestState.ITransportRequestState)
member.summary: Selects next node uri on request state
member.returns: bool hint whether the new current node needs to pinged first

member.name: P:Elasticsearch.Net.ElasticsearchResponse`1.ServerError
member.summary: This property returns the mapped elasticsearch server exception

member.name: P:Elasticsearch.Net.ElasticsearchResponse`1.ResponseRaw
member.summary: The raw byte response, only set when IncludeRawResponse() is set on Connection configuration

member.name: P:Elasticsearch.Net.ElasticsearchResponse`1.SuccessOrKnownError
member.summary: If the response is succesful or has a known error (400-500 range) The client should not retry this call

member.name: T:Elasticsearch.Net.ElasticsearchClient
member.summary: Raw operations with elasticsearch
Low level client that exposes all of elasticsearch API endpoints but leaves you in charge of building request and handling the response

member.name: M:Elasticsearch.Net.DynamicDictionary.TrySetMember(System.Dynamic.SetMemberBinder,System.Object)
member.summary: Provides the implementation for operations that set member values. Classes derived from the class can override this method to specify dynamic behavior for operations such as setting a value for a property.
member.returns: true if the operation is successful; otherwise, false. If this method returns false, the run-time binder of the language determines the behavior. (In most cases, a language-specific run-time exception is thrown.)
member.param: Provides information about the object that called the dynamic operation. The binder.Name property provides the name of the member to which the value is being assigned. For example, for the statement sampleObject.SampleProperty = "Test", where sampleObject is an instance of the class derived from the class, binder.Name returns "SampleProperty". The binder.IgnoreCase property specifies whether the member name is case-sensitive.
The value to set to the member. For example, for sampleObject.SampleProperty = "Test", where sampleObject is an instance of the class derived from the class, the is "Test".

member.name: M:Elasticsearch.Net.DynamicDictionary.TryGetMember(System.Dynamic.GetMemberBinder,System.Object@)

member.returns: true if the operation is successful; otherwise, false. If this method returns false, the run-time binder of the language determines the behavior. (In most cases, a run-time exception is thrown.)
member.param: Provides information about the object that called the dynamic operation. The binder.Name property provides the name of the member on which the dynamic operation is performed. For example, for the Console.WriteLine(sampleObject.SampleProperty) statement, where sampleObject is an instance of the class derived from the class, binder.Name returns "SampleProperty". The binder.IgnoreCase property specifies whether the member name is case-sensitive.
The result of the get operation. For example, if the method is called for a property, you can assign the property value to .

member.name: M:Elasticsearch.Net.ElasticsearchDynamicValue.TryBinaryOperation(System.Dynamic.BinaryOperationBinder,System.Object,System.Object@)
member.summary: Provides implementation for binary operations. Classes derived from the class can override this method to specify dynamic behavior for operations such as addition and multiplication.
member.returns: true if the operation is successful; otherwise, false. If this method returns false, the run-time binder of the language determines the behavior. (In most cases, a language-specific run-time exception is thrown.)
member.param: Provides information about the binary operation. The binder.Operation property returns an object. For example, for the sum = first + second statement, where first and second are derived from the DynamicObject class, binder.Operation returns ExpressionType.Add.
The right operand for the binary operation. For example, for the sum = first + second statement, where first and second are derived from the DynamicObject class, is equal to second.
The result of the binary operation.

member.name: M:Elasticsearch.Net.ElasticsearchDynamicValue.TryConvert(System.Dynamic.ConvertBinder,System.Object@)
member.summary: Provides implementation for type conversion operations. Classes derived from the class can override this method to specify dynamic behavior for operations that convert an object from one type to another.
member.returns: true if the operation is successful; otherwise, false. If this method returns false, the run-time binder of the language determines the behavior. (In most cases, a language-specific run-time exception is thrown.)
member.param: Provides information about the conversion operation. The binder.Type property provides the type to which the object must be converted. For example, for the statement (String)sampleObject in C# (CType(sampleObject, Type) in Visual Basic), where sampleObject is an instance of the class derived from the class, binder.Type returns the type. The binder.Explicit property provides information about the kind of conversion that occurs. It returns true for explicit conversion and false for implicit conversion.
The result of the type conversion operation.

member.name: M:Elasticsearch.Net.Serialization.JsonObject.TryConvert(System.Dynamic.ConvertBinder,System.Object@)
member.summary: Provides implementation for type conversion operations. Classes derived from the class can override this method to specify dynamic behavior for operations that convert an object from one type to another.
member.param: Provides information about the conversion operation. The binder.Type property provides the type to which the object must be converted. For example, for the statement (String)sampleObject in C# (CType(sampleObject, Type) in Visual Basic), where sampleObject is an instance of the class derived from the class, binder.Type returns the type. The binder.Explicit property provides information about the kind of conversion that occurs. It returns true for explicit conversion and false for implicit conversion.
The result of the type conversion operation.
member.returns: Alwasy returns true.

member.returns: Alwasy returns true.

member.name: M:Elasticsearch.Net.Serialization.JsonObject.TryGetIndex(System.Dynamic.GetIndexBinder,System.Object[],System.Object@)
member.summary: Provides the implementation for operations that get a value by index. Classes derived from the class can override this method to specify dynamic behavior for indexing operations.
member.param: Provides information about the operation.

The indexes that are used in the operation. For example, for the sampleObject[3] operation in C# (sampleObject(3) in Visual Basic), where sampleObject is derived from the DynamicObject class, is equal to 3.
The result of the index operation.
member.returns: Alwasy returns true.

member.name: M:Elasticsearch.Net.Serialization.JsonObject.TryGetMember(System.Dynamic.GetMemberBinder,System.Object@)
member.summary: Provides the implementation for operations that get member values. Classes derived from the class can override this method to specify dynamic behavior for operations such as getting a value for a property.
member.param: Provides information about the object that called the dynamic operation. The binder.Name property provides the name of the member on which the dynamic operation is performed. For example, for the Console.WriteLine(sampleObject.SampleProperty) statement, where sampleObject is an instance of the class derived from the class, binder.Name returns "SampleProperty". The binder.IgnoreCase property specifies whether the member name is case-sensitive.
The result of the get operation. For example, if the method is called for a property, you can assign the property value to .
member.returns: Alwasy returns true.

member.name: M:Elasticsearch.Net.Serialization.JsonObject.TrySetIndex(System.Dynamic.SetIndexBinder,System.Object[],System.Object)
member.summary: Provides the implementation for operations that set a value by index. Classes derived from the class can override this method to specify dynamic behavior for operations that access objects by a specified index.
member.param: Provides information about the operation.

The indexes that are used in the operation. For example, for the sampleObject[3] = 10 operation in C# (sampleObject(3) = 10 in Visual Basic), where sampleObject is derived from the class, is equal to 3.

The value to set to the object that has the specified index. For example, for the sampleObject[3] = 10 operation in C# (sampleObject(3) = 10 in Visual Basic), where sampleObject is derived from the class, is equal to 10.
member.returns: true if the operation is successful; otherwise, false. If this method returns false, the run-time binder of the language determines the behavior. (In most cases, a language-specific run-time exception is thrown.

member.name: M:Elasticsearch.Net.Serialization.JsonObject.TrySetMember(System.Dynamic.SetMemberBinder,System.Object)
member.summary: Provides the implementation for operations that set member values. Classes derived from the class can override this method to specify dynamic behavior for operations such as setting a value for a property.
member.param: Provides information about the object that called the dynamic operation. The binder.Name property provides the name of the member to which the value is being assigned. For example, for the statement sampleObject.SampleProperty = "Test", where sampleObject is an instance of the class derived from the class, binder.Name returns "SampleProperty". The binder.IgnoreCase property specifies whether the member name is case-sensitive.
The value to set to the member. For example, for sampleObject.SampleProperty = "Test", where sampleObject is an instance of the class derived from the class, the is "Test".
member.returns: true if the operation is successful; otherwise, false. If this method returns false, the run-time binder of the language determines the behavior. (In most cases, a language-specific run-time exception is thrown.)

member.name: T:Elasticsearch.Net.Serialization.SimpleJson
member.summary:
This class encodes and decodes JSON strings. Spec. details, see http://www.json.org/
JSON uses Arrays and Objects. These correspond here to the datatypes JsonArray(IList<object>) and JsonObject(IDictionary<string,object>). All numbers are parsed to doubles.
